intro: Trachyspermum triradiatum, commonly known as Indian cumin, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into dry, three-lobed fruits, which are the primary source of its essential oils. Its leaves and seeds are used in traditional medicine and cooking for their pungent, spicy flavor. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun, making it a hardy and versatile herbaceous plant.
